2020-07-12T15:03:55Z: And that's it from us! Thanks for joining us this weekend - we'll be back in a few days' time for the Hungarian GP.
2020-07-12T15:03:29Z: And here's the report from another great race in Austria: Styrian GP: Hamilton takes controlled victory in Mercedes 1-2 as Ferraris collideMercedes' Lewis Hamilton beat Valtteri Bottas to victory in Formula 1's first Styrian Grand Prix, where Ferrari drivers Charles Leclerc and Sebastian Vettel collided on lap one and retired
2020-07-12T14:52:49Z: And so, endeth our two races at the Red Bull Ring. Disappointing that we won't get another one until next year, we hope. The call of Hungary beckons next week.
2020-07-12T14:50:23Z: The trophy robots, when they're not at work
2020-07-12T14:47:11Z: Watch out for the trophy robots, people.
2020-07-12T14:41:22Z: A lot of battles in the midfield, we barely saw the top three all day! Hamilton, Bottas and Verstappen the order on the podium.
2020-07-12T14:41:14Z: Behind that dramatic finish, Sainz duly held on to the fastest lap in P9 with Kvyat rounding out the points in the AlphaTauri. Raikkonen had too much to do in P11 while both Haas drivers got ahead of Giovinazzi who dropped to P14. Gasly came home in P15 in front of Russell and Latifi to round out the finishers.
2020-07-12T14:38:57Z: Perez pipped Stroll and Ricciardo at the line there! Fractions in it.
2020-07-12T14:38:36Z: Phwoar, that was a breathtaking finish! We need a moment to process that...
2020-07-12T14:38:03Z: Norris takes fifth at the final corner! Perez's broken front wing counted against him, and Norris managed to take both Racing Points on the last lap!
2020-07-12T14:37:27Z: Bottas comes home second, 13.7s down on Hamilton, as Verstappen completes the podium.
2020-07-12T14:36:50Z: And Lewis Hamilton wins in Austria!
2020-07-12T14:36:40Z: Final flurry of action! On the penultimate lap Stroll dives up the inside at Turn 3 on Ricciardo, which invites Norris into the action, to see the Racing Point driver take P6 ahead of Norris. Ricciardo is down to P8.
2020-07-12T14:36:01Z: Perez tries to pass Bottas, but can't do it - and he's got a broken front wing!
2020-07-12T14:34:15Z: Sainz duly delivers with a 1m05.619s to set the fastest lap of the race.
2020-07-12T14:33:58Z: Verstappen's coming in for fresh tyres to try for a fastest lap. He's got nearly 30s on Albon - but he'll reemerge in traffic.
2020-07-12T14:33:29Z: Replay of Stroll nearly coming to blows with Ricciardo, who planted his Renault into the centre of the track at Turn 3.
2020-07-12T14:32:54Z: Sainz has pitted from P9 with three laps to go. It is a 'free' stop as he has enough of a time buffer to stay ahead of Kvyat, so he is going for the fastest lap and that bonus point with the aid of fresh soft tyres.
2020-07-12T14:32:15Z: But Verstappen's efforts count for nothing on the following lap, and Bottas claims second at the same corner. Lovely racing.
2020-07-12T14:31:19Z: Bottas goes at Verstappen at turn 3, can't make it but looks to have the deal done at Turn 4. Then, Verstappen comes back at him, getting great purchase out of the corner and claims back second!
2020-07-12T14:30:19Z: Norris puts in a new fastest lap of 1m07.286s - a feat he managed last weekend to earn his podium place - and he is on the charge to catch Stroll.
2020-07-12T14:28:04Z: Perez punched in a 1m07.396s on the previous run, doing ANOTHER fastest lap. But Albon responds with a 1m07.4s, so he's pushing the Red Bull all the way.
2020-07-12T14:27:22Z: Bottas is now just 2.2s off of Verstappen now - was that 10 laps or 17 laps?
2020-07-12T14:27:01Z: It is a similar situation at McLaren as Sainz allows Norris to overtake him for P8, with the British driver now hunting down Ricciardo and Stroll.
2020-07-12T14:25:32Z: Alfa Romeo call for Giovinazzi and Raikkonen to swap places with the Finn faster and on fresher tyres. That puts Raikkonen into P11 and the chance to chase after Kvyat in the final points position.
2020-07-12T14:25:22Z: Stroll and Ricciardo both set a 1m08.406s on the previous lap - a real stalemate in that battle.
2020-07-12T14:24:17Z: Verstappen's got a flapping front-wing footplate. With Hamilton sharing a name with a musical, perhaps Foot(plate)loose can form a similar theatrical production with Max's Red Bull.
2020-07-12T14:23:30Z: Albon personal-bested on the previous lap, managing to stave off Perez's advances.
2020-07-12T14:22:20Z: Stroll still hasn't made any inroads into Ricciardo - Perez is now 9s up the road from the pair.
2020-07-12T14:22:05Z: Gasly is enjoying his soft tyres much more as he makes light work of overtaking both Russell and Latifi to move up to P15.
2020-07-12T14:21:19Z: Perez gets baulked by Russell as he attempts to lap the Williams, losing some ground to Albon that lap.
2020-07-12T14:19:14Z: Giovinazzi has been shown a black and white flag for abusing track limits which puts him in the FIA's bad books for the rest of the race. The Alfa Romeo driver needs to keep it within track limits or he risks a penalty.
2020-07-12T14:18:53Z: Another fastest lap for Perez, a 1m07.410s from the Racing Point driver. Albon's going to come under pressure very shortly.
2020-07-12T14:17:22Z: Perez is 2s behind Albon now, so he could be in with a shout of fourth here.
2020-07-12T14:17:01Z: Gasly has now dropped behind both Williams drivers and is running in last place. Further up the road Grosjean is back in front of Haas team-mate Magnussen for P13.
2020-07-12T14:16:42Z: A look at the front - Hamilton is 5.9s clear of Verstappen, while Bottas' attempts to eat into the Red Bull's advantage has petered out.
2020-07-12T14:14:55Z: Ricciardo's got his lines right into turn 4 so far, keeping Stroll at bay on that last tour.
2020-07-12T14:13:26Z: And that's a fastest lap for Perez, a 1m07.578s! A surging lap from Sergio.
2020-07-12T14:13:21Z: Gasly on the hard tyres is struggling for pace as Raikkonen gets ahead of him for P12. AlphaTauri call in Gasly for a second pitstop which drops him down to P15.
2020-07-12T14:12:41Z: Stroll's going after Ricciardo now, he's within half a second of the Australian driver.
2020-07-12T14:11:30Z: Raikkonen proves that point as he charges past Magnussen for P13 at Turn 7, while further ahead of him Alfa Romeo team-mate Giovinazzi has got by Gasly for P11.
2020-07-12T14:11:20Z: And Perez gets Ricciardo now, clearing him at Turn 4 and will now go after Albon. Having qualified way down, Perez is on a mission.
2020-07-12T14:09:26Z: Raikkonen duly pitted for Alfa Romeo to drop back to P14 and switches on to the soft tyres, so he should be able to launch some late attacks on fresher and faster rubber.
2020-07-12T14:09:02Z: Stroll came back at Perez, but can't make the inroads into his team-mate. They'll have to put the battle to one side and go after Ricciardo's Renault.
2020-07-12T14:08:08Z: Lovely battle between the pink cars, Perez hangs around the outside of turn 5 and clears Stroll for sixth. Great racing chops from the Mexican driver today.
2020-07-12T14:06:55Z: Meantime, Stroll is just 1.2s behind fifth-placed Ricciardo, as the Racing Points will be looking to score more, erm, racing points.
2020-07-12T14:06:41Z: Raikkonen is the only driver yet to pit so he is out of position in P9 splitting the McLaren duo. Everywhere else outside the top five drivers it is a two-by-two in team formation. Very orderly.
2020-07-12T14:06:22Z: Hamilton is 5.3s clear of Verstappen, who's 6.6s clear of Bottas. Albon is a further 31.1s behind.
2020-07-12T14:05:24Z: That's now dropped to 10 laps and yellow difficulty. I don't get this graphic, man. Why can't they have a numerical setting, like a toaster? We all know three is medium brown, etc...
2020-07-12T14:04:40Z: Bottas will allegedly be in striking distance of Verstappen in 17 laps' time, which is quite a lot down on the four laps from before. It will still, once he gets there, be orange difficult according to the graphic.
2020-07-12T14:02:10Z: Perez, who pitted from P4, fights off Sainz going around the outside at Turn 6 on his out lap to take P8 and slot in behind his Racing Point team-mate Stroll.
2020-07-12T14:01:23Z: Perez had stopped, and now Norris does so too.
2020-07-12T14:01:05Z: Bottas pumps in a 1m07.591s, catching Verstappen.
2020-07-12T14:00:05Z: Perez and Norris, currently P4 and P5, are still yet to pit. Ricciardo's on the softs now, having started on the yellow-marked boots.
2020-07-12T13:59:00Z: Stroll isn't hanging around on his new medium tyres as he passes both Alfa Romeo drivers on consecutive laps to move up to P8. Sainz has joined this fight after his slow stop dropped him down the order.
2020-07-12T13:57:03Z: Stroll comes back out right in front of Grosjean but defends his position, as Sainz makes the most of the action to overtake Grosjean for P12.
2020-07-12T13:57:02Z: Albon pits for fresh medium tyres, rejoins P7.
2020-07-12T13:56:02Z: Bottas emerges behind Verstappen, 8.2s in arrears.
2020-07-12T13:55:11Z: Bottas now pits for new tyres. 2.3s is the time he's stationary for.
2020-07-12T13:54:28Z: Sainz effectively has to undercut Ricciardo now, given the Renault was just a second behind the McLaren.
2020-07-12T13:53:54Z: Perez has caught up with his Racing Point team-mate Stroll and is in DRS range - but he doesn't need it as Stroll pits.
2020-07-12T13:53:20Z: One of them, Carlos Sainz Jr, comes in for mediums - and the left rear's a bit slow on! That might help the chasing Ricciardo massively.
2020-07-12T13:52:52Z: The tyre strategy graphic suggested the window for softs was somewhere around Lap 20 to take hard tyres. We're nearly at half distance and there's a glut of cars still on them.
2020-07-12T13:51:34Z: Ricciardo's just a second off of Sainz here. The Renault driver will take Sainz's McLaren seat next year - can he also take his position?
2020-07-12T13:50:34Z: Hamilton did a 1m07.863s on his fresh tyres - that's pretty good, I suppose.
2020-07-12T13:49:14Z: Bottas has to up his pace to clear Verstappen in the pits - but the Dutchman was faster on the previous tour by half a second.
2020-07-12T13:46:30Z: There's a Mercedes stop - Hamilton comes in for fresh boots. He ditches the soft rubber and pops on mediums.
2020-07-12T13:46:15Z: Ocon's afternoon is over. The French driver pulls into the Renault pit to retire.
2020-07-12T13:44:45Z: Gasly is the first of the midfield runners to pit with his AlphaTauri crew swapping his soft tyres for a new set of hard tyres.
2020-07-12T13:44:09Z: Verstappen returns to the circuit ahead of Albon. Mercedes probably won't respond - both drivers are happy with tyre life at the moment.
2020-07-12T13:43:28Z: Red Bull brings Verstappen in anyway, so that graphic is superfluous now.
2020-07-12T13:43:00Z: The TV graphic suggests Bottas will be in striking distance of Verstappen in four laps, with a difficult overtaking, er, difficulty. That's based on the metric of having a finger in the air and disregarding DRS.
2020-07-12T13:40:30Z: Hamilton's now 5.5s clear of Verstappen, that's about half the top straightaway. Bottas is homing in on the Dutchman.
2020-07-12T13:40:16Z: Gasly is going backwards in this race as he loses another place, this time to Norris, who takes the final points place in his McLaren.
2020-07-12T13:38:33Z: Hamilton punches in a 1m08.183 that last lap. Another fastest lap.
2020-07-12T13:37:59Z: Ricciardo makes the move - meaning the order from P5 to P8 is Sainz and Dan and Ocon, Stroll. It's all your brain and body needs.
2020-07-12T13:36:54Z: Perez, an eager spectator of Stroll's overtake on Gasly, copies the move a lap later to pass the French driver for P9. The Racing Point pair are hunting down the Renaults.
2020-07-12T13:36:00Z: They'll have to sort it out between themselves soon, as Stroll is going to want to buy into this battle soonish.
2020-07-12T13:35:38Z: But still, that's evidence that Ricciardo has the legs on Ocon - he just can't make the move.
2020-07-12T13:35:27Z: Stroll, who looked at a move on Gasly the lap before, gets the overtake done around the outside at Turn 4 to promote himself to P8.
2020-07-12T13:35:05Z: Ricciardo, after a bit of a rest, has charged right back up to Ocon - and tries to go around the outside at Turn 4! He can't quite make it work...
2020-07-12T13:33:51Z: Perez, another driver who started further down the grid than expected following the wet qualifying shake-up, gets by Norris at Turn 4 to take P10. That puts the Mexican directly behind his Racing Point team-mate Stroll who is troubling Gasly in P8.
2020-07-12T13:32:39Z: Albon's not really got the pace for Bottas at the minute, and he's now 10s down on the Finnish driver. Not a slight on Albon, more of a shout-out to the pace Bottas has.
2020-07-12T13:31:26Z: Magnussen is struggling for pace on his soft tyres as Raikkonen, on medium tyres, gets past him at Turn 4 to take P15.
2020-07-12T13:30:22Z: Bottas grabbed the fastest lap, but Hamilton decides he's not happy with that and promptly does a 1m08.484s.
2020-07-12T13:29:18Z: Raikkonen, caught up behind the Ferrari tangle on the opening lap, is now ahead of both Williams in P16. Ahead of him Grosjean has moved ahead of his Haas team-mate Magnussen to take P14 as he chases after Giovinazzi.
2020-07-12T13:28:12Z: Verstappen did take 0.3s out of Hamilton that lap, doing a 1m08.7s run while Hamilton set a 1m09.0s.
2020-07-12T13:27:26Z: Hamilton's got 2.7s over Verstappen at this stage, with Bottas a further 3.9s back, and Albon 6.3 behind him.
2020-07-12T13:26:48Z: Giovinazzi has enjoyed a strong start to his race having gone from P19 on the grid up to P13 having just overtaken Magnussen.
2020-07-12T13:25:47Z: Sainz isn't quite letting Albon scamper away with this, presumably looking to make the difference as the Renaults are in touching distance too.
2020-07-12T13:24:43Z: Albon steals past Sainz to grab P4, nice and easy into the site of last weekend's clash with Hamilton.
2020-07-12T13:24:42Z: Stroll is back in front of Norris in the tussle for P9 and that fight is allowing Gasly to pull a gap in P8.
2020-07-12T13:23:03Z: Albon's going after Sainz now, with DRS in hand, looking to get in the mix amongst the front-runners.
2020-07-12T13:22:28Z: Bottas, meanwhile, clears Sainz - and the Finn's going to go after the front two.
2020-07-12T13:22:05Z: Hamilton sets a 1m08.631s to lay down the fastest-lap gauntlet early.
2020-07-12T13:21:45Z: Leclerc is in the pits again and his race is over. Double Ferrari DNF before the start of the sixth lap. Ouch.
2020-07-12T13:20:50Z: Sainz, meanwhile, has Bottas for company having dropped off the back of Hamilton and Verstappen.
2020-07-12T13:20:30Z: Ocon's right on Albon's six, looking to take fifth place back.
2020-07-12T13:20:06Z: Norris gets ahead of Stroll for P9 on the restart in the charge to Turn 3. Further back Russell has gone wide and off track which means the Williams driver is down to P18.
2020-07-12T13:19:09Z: We're back underway! Hamilton drops the hammer and scampers off from Verstappen.
2020-07-12T13:18:29Z: A strange incident between the Ferrari drivers. Leclerc pitted but he is able to continue down in last place. Raikkonen also appeared to get caught up in the incident which has put him down to P18.
2020-07-12T13:17:54Z: Safety car's coming in this lap.
2020-07-12T13:17:08Z: The bunch squeezes up at the tight Turn 3, Leclerc attempts to dive up the inside of Vettel but they bash wheels which puts Leclerc on the kerb and launches him on to the rear of his team-mate. Vettel makes it back to the pits but he retires from the race.
2020-07-12T13:17:07Z: Leclerc's got the old wing on now - so much for those upgrades.
2020-07-12T13:16:24Z: Albon's got past Ocon too, solid start from the Red Bull driver seeking to atone for an iffy quali yesterday.
2020-07-12T13:14:37Z: Hamilton holds the lead, but Sainz hangs on behind Verstappen, he's going for second...
2020-07-12T13:14:35Z: The Ferrari pair have made contact at Turn 3! Vettel has a broken rear wing!
2020-07-12T13:13:29Z: The 2020 Styrian Grand Prix is go!
2020-07-12T13:12:01Z: The cars begin to line up for the start.
2020-07-12T13:10:28Z: We're away for the formation lap!
2020-07-12T13:09:36Z: And Vettel's on the mediums too - as are Kvyat, Raikkonen, Giovinazzi and Latifi.
2020-07-12T13:09:05Z: Free choice of tyres after a wet quali - everyone in the top 10 bar Ricciardo start on softs.
2020-07-12T13:05:11Z: Temperatures have dropped a little since we last mentioned it -  19.8 degrees C air, 37.6 degrees C track. Crucially, no risk of rain.
2020-07-12T13:04:15Z: Is it us, or does the shade of yellow on this year's Renault remind you of the 2000 Jordan? It's very retina-scorching.
2020-07-12T13:02:19Z: Behind Hamilton and Verstappen, we have Sainz starting third, looking to help McLaren to another big weekend here in Austria. He'll have to be Sainzsible in the opening corners to hold his position.
2020-07-12T12:55:52Z: Let's be honest, F1's decision to broadcast a paraglider instead of the drivers standing against inequality is questionable at best.
2020-07-12T12:53:27Z: Lots of questions around this weekend - will Verstappen challenge Hamilton? Will Ferrari and Racing Point recover? Will Stevens drove for Manor in 2015.
2020-07-12T12:49:47Z: Track temperature is 39.7 degrees C, so it's not blisteringly hot today. The mercury was pushing much higher numbers on Friday, so these are new conditions once again.
2020-07-12T12:48:52Z: Air temperature, as it stands is about 20.4 degrees C, which is room temperature. Although, surely every room is room temperature...
2020-07-12T12:46:40Z: After 71 laps, we will indeed have a Vienna of this second Austria race. Too tenuous?
2020-07-12T12:44:01Z: Our second race weekend in Austria in a row, much to the delight of Red Bull Ring fans - who says the Graz is always greener on the other side?
2020-07-12T12:37:59Z: On that Grosjean news, he'll start from the pitlane, while Giovinazzi will start at the back following a gearbox change - but he was starting in 19th anyway, so no change.
2020-07-12T12:36:48Z: The weather should be perfect today, unlike yesterday's deluge! The F2 and F3 races went ahead earlier today, and ART won both of them as Christian Lundgaard beat Dan Ticktum in F2, while Theo Pourchaire inherited victory in F3 after Jake Hughes and Liam Lawson collided ahead of him.
2020-07-12T12:34:45Z: Some news, as Romain Grosjean, who suffered a water pump failure yesterday, has avoided being disqualified after Haas broke parc ferme to fix his car: Grosjean avoids exclusion risk after parc ferme breach for F1 Styrian GPRomain Grosjean has escaped the risk of disqualification from the Styrian Grand Prix, after his Haas team broke parc ferme rules following qualifying on Saturday night
2020-07-12T12:23:44Z: Hello everyone, and welcome to our Autosport Live blog - it's a fine ol' Sunday afternoon and F1's Styrian GP will be underway in just 45 minutes!
